result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William R. Cantrell Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:00 am - DA calls cases 15CF61 and 15CM82 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant William R. Cantrell appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE regarding his health today.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to 15CF61.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty on 15CF61 and orders entry of JOC, and on motion of DA, dismisses but reads in 15CM82 for purposes of payment of service fees.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$250 DNAAS
$90 SBDA
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.
30 days jail with huber to take medications and is to commence within 30 days of 9/8/17 with continued obedience to bond.

DE advised to loss of rights as a convicted felon

Contraband evidence to be destroyed after appeal time has expired

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2017 at 11:00 am.

2:17 pm - DA calls cases 15CF61 and 15CM82 and states appearances. Defendant William R. Cantrell appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comments by Atty Lex.  To be scheduled for another date.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 5, 2017 at 02:15 pm.

1:46 pm - DA calls cases 15CF61 and 15CM82 and appearances.  Defendant William R. Cantrell appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lex states that DE has just taken medication and is not comfortable proceeding and asks this be rescheduled.  So ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on June 6, 2017 at 11:00 am.

11:33 am - DA calls cases 15CF61 and 15CM82 and states appearances.  Defendant William R. Cantrell appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No miranda good child issues on either case.  15CF61 motion re: CI, a response was filed by state, and reviewed by court.  Comments by Lex.  Dismissed motion without prejudice.
Motion hearing on October 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.

2:08 pm - DA calls cases 15CF61 and 15CM82. Defendant William R. Cantrell appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CM82 is a status.  Lex asks for a new pre-trial on that case.  DA files Information.  Parties received, reviewed and wave its reading.  Lex presents a waiver of preliminary exam form to court.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Court finds waiver to be free/knowing, etc. and accepts.  Lex proceeds to arraingment.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.
Status conference on May 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

11:05 am - 15CF61 & 15CM82 - Defendant William R. Cantrell appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed competency evaluation. Exam by Court. Court finds DE competent to proceed in both cases. Adj. 11:06 am.
Competency hearing on March 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:02 am - Defendant William R. Cantrell appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comments by Attorney Lex regarding competence. DA indicates 15CF61 is also an open case.  Attorney Lex stipulates to probable cause in both cases and requests evaluation be done for both cases. Adj. 11:03 am.
Motion hearing at 01-19-2016 11:00 am
statements

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

Defendant William R. Cantrell appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
